question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
An investment of $\$24,\!000$ is made in a government bond that will pay $1\%$ bi-monthly interest (meaning that the investment will increase by $1\%$ every two months). At the end of five years, what is the total number of dollars in this investment?

Express your answer to the nearest whole number.
inference: Final Answer: $\boxed{\$32,\!582}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Five years make sixty months, so interest will have been compounded 30 times. That means that the investment will have grown to $\$24,\!000 \cdot 1.01^{30} \approx \boxed{\$32,\!348}$, to the nearest dollar.
